headline: Apple shareholders reject call for report on China manufacturing risks
summary: Apple shareholders on Tuesday rejected a proposal to report on ‌the company's dependence on China ‌to manufacture most of its products.  The vote came after ​Apple has worked for nearly a decade to broaden its manufacturing base to Vietnam, India and the U.S., where it said ‌earlier that it ⁠would assemble some of its Mac mini computers to meet U.S. ⁠demand starting later this year.  During a question-and-answer session, Apple Chief Executive Tim Cook ​told shareholders ​that the company ​continues to plan for ‌annual increases to its dividend but is prioritizing investments in technologies such as AI.

raw.headline: Apple shareholders reject call for report on China manufacturing risks
raw.summary: Apple shareholders on Tuesday rejected a proposal to report on ‌the company's dependence on China ‌to manufacture most of its products.  The vote came after ​Apple has worked for nearly a decade to broaden its manufacturing base to Vietnam, India and the U.S., where it said ‌earlier that it ⁠would assemble some of its Mac mini computers to meet U.S. ⁠demand starting later this year.  During a question-and-answer session, Apple Chief Executive Tim Cook ​told shareholders ​that the company ​continues to plan for ‌annual increases to its dividend but is prioritizing investments in technologies such as AI.

headline: The Era of "Middlemen" is Over. Max 95% Payout Rate. Next-Generation Video Platform "Chat Market" Launches Simultaneously in the U.S. and Japan, Turning Individual Skills into "True Assets"
summary: TOKYO, February 24, 2026--ONE STEP Co., Ltd. announces the simultaneous launch of "Chat Market" in the U.S. and Japan. Chat Market is a progressive web app (PWA) based video distribution and skill-sharing platform. This service resolves the structural issue of high platform fees (30-50%) in the existing app market by utilizing the latest web technology and a unique payout system, creating a "new economic zone" where creators and professionals can earn their rightful revenue.

headline: Facebook owner Meta to buy AI chips from AMD in deal worth up to $100 billion
summary: Facebook owner Meta Platforms will buy artificial intelligence chips from Advanced Micro Devices in a deal that will also give it the opportunity to buy up to a 10% stake of the chip company.  Meta will buy AMD's latest chips, the MI450, to help power data centers.  The companies said that AMD issued Meta a performance-based warrant for up to 160 million shares of its common stock at $0.01 a piece, structured to vest as long as certain milestones are achieved.

headline: Apple accelerates U.S. manufacturing, with Mac mini production coming later this year
summary: CUPERTINO, Calif., February 24, 2026--Apple® today announced a significant expansion of factory operations in Houston, bringing the future production of Mac mini® to the U.S. for the first time. The company will also expand advanced AI server manufacturing at the factory and provide hands-on training at its new Advanced Manufacturing Center beginning later this year. Altogether, Apple’s Houston operations will create thousands of jobs.

raw.headline: Apple accelerates U.S. manufacturing, with Mac mini production coming later this year

The company will also expand advanced AI server manufacturing at the factory and provide hands-on training at its new Advanced Manufacturing Center beginning later this year. Altogether, Apple’s Houston operations will create thousands of jobs.

headline: Apple to shift some Mac Mini production to Houston from Asia, WSJ reports
summary: Apple will move some production of its Mac Mini desktop computer to the U.S. from Asia, with a ‌new manufacturing effort set to begin later this year at a ‌Foxconn facility in north Houston, The Wall Street Journal reported on Monday.  In May, U.S. President Donald Trump had threatened Apple with a 25% tariff on products manufactured overseas, a sharp ‌reversal from earlier policy ⁠when his administration had exempted smartphones, computers and other electronics from rounds of tariffs on Chinese imports.  The production for Mac ⁠Mini will continue in Asia, its chief operating officer Sabih Khan told WSJ, adding that the facility will meet local demand as the U.S. assembly line ​ramps ​up.

raw.headline: Apple to shift some Mac Mini production to Houston from Asia, WSJ reports
raw.summary: Apple will move some production of its Mac Mini desktop computer to the U.S. from Asia, with a ‌new manufacturing effort set to begin later this year at a ‌Foxconn facility in north Houston, The Wall Street Journal reported on Monday.  In May, U.S. President Donald Trump had threatened Apple with a 25% tariff on products manufactured overseas, a sharp ‌reversal from earlier policy ⁠when his administration had exempted smartphones, computers and other electronics from rounds of tariffs on Chinese imports.  The production for Mac ⁠Mini will continue in Asia, its chief operating officer Sabih Khan told WSJ, adding that the facility will meet local demand as the U.S. assembly line ​ramps ​up.

headline: Inside Apple’s Push to Build an All-American Chip
summary: Apple is helping to bring chip manufacturing back to the U.S. To find out how far the company still has to go, WSJ’s Rolfe Winkler went on an exclusive, behind-the-scenes visit to several of the company’s suppliers in the Southwest.  PHOENIX—On a desolate stretch of land dotted with cactuses some 30 minutes north of Phoenix, more than 30 cranes tower over a construction site 2½ times the size of New York City’s Central Park.  The plant’s biggest customer is  Apple  which is using its enormous purchasing power to help boost American chip production.

raw.headline: Inside Apple’s Push to Build an All-American Chip
raw.summary: Apple is helping to bring chip manufacturing back to the U.S. To find out how far the company still has to go, WSJ’s Rolfe Winkler went on an exclusive, behind-the-scenes visit to several of the company’s suppliers in the Southwest.  PHOENIX—On a desolate stretch of land dotted with cactuses some 30 minutes north of Phoenix, more than 30 cranes tower over a construction site 2½ times the size of New York City’s Central Park.  The plant’s biggest customer is  Apple  which is using its enormous purchasing power to help boost American chip production.

headline: We Got Rare Access to the U.S. Factories Making Apple's Advanced Chips
summary: Apple is helping to bring chip manufacturing back to the United States. To find out how far the company still has to go, WSJ’s Rolfe Winkler went on an exclusive, behind-the-scenes visit to several of the company’s suppliers in the Southwest.

raw.headline: We Got Rare Access to the U.S. Factories Making Apple's Advanced Chips
raw.summary: Apple is helping to bring chip manufacturing back to the United States. To find out how far the company still has to go, WSJ’s Rolfe Winkler went on an exclusive, behind-the-scenes visit to several of the company’s suppliers in the Southwest.

headline: Apple Plans to Manufacture Mac Mini in Houston
summary: Apple  will move some production of its Mac Mini desktop computer to the U.S. from Asia, the company told The Wall Street Journal, its latest initiative to reshore parts of its vast supply chain.  The new manufacturing effort will begin later this year at a Foxconn facility in north Houston, said  Sabih Khan,  Apple’s chief operating officer.
